meanings.definition: To harness or yoke (oxen or horses) to a vehicle or implement.
meanings.sent1: The farmer needed to inspan the horses to the plow for planting.
meanings.sent2: The team of horses will inspan to the wagon to carry the heavy load.
meanings.sent3: Trying to inspan a squirrel to pull the cart would be quite a sight!
meanings.sent4: She inspanned her determination and hard work to achieve her goals.
meanings.sent5: The image of the horses inspanned to the carriage stayed in his mind.

meanings.definition: To enlist or recruit for a task or duty.
meanings.sent1: The general decided to inspan more soldiers for the upcoming battle.
meanings.sent2: They will inspan volunteers to help with the community clean-up.
meanings.sent3: I could inspan my friends to join me for the movie night.
meanings.sent4: She inspanned all her energy and focus to complete the project on time.
meanings.sent5: The teacher inspanned the students' creativity for the school play.
